bibl.title: Page of an Oracle Book: Papyrus Kellis 96.150.
Proceedings of the 27th International Congress of Papyrology Warsaw, 29 July - 3 August 2013.

bibl.note: Papyrus from the 4th century found in the Area D/8 within context 7 in Room 7 and containing a series of numbered oracular predictions in Greek. It is a unique text with a special vocabulary and a remarkable mix of Greek and Egyptian deities.
bibl.seg: Francisca A.J. Hoogendijk, Page of an Oracle Book: Papyrus Kellis 96.150.

Tomasz Derda, Adam Łajtar & Jakub Urbanik (edd.), in cooperation with Andrzej Mirończuk & Tomasz Ochała, Proceedings of the 27th International Congress of Papyrology, Warsaw, 29 July - 3 August 2013. Volume II. Subliterary Papyri, Documentary Papyri, Scribal Practices, Linguistic Matters = The Journal of Juristic Papyrology. Supplements. Volume XXVIII (Warsaw, 2016) pp. 595-622, 2 pll.

Papyrus from the 4th century found in the Area D/8 within context 7 in Room 7 and containing a series of numbered oracular predictions in Greek. It is a unique text with a special vocabulary and a remarkable mix of Greek and Egyptian deities.
